main event: An unidentified object, possibly a meteor, was sighted over Seattle, Washington on May 11, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a vivid blue sphere with flaming sparks or streamers, traveling nearly straight down and exploding in a brilliant flash.
The explosion was accompanied by a tremendous shock wave that lasted for approximately 9 seconds.
Two local astronomers stated the object was a meteor, and are currently searching for fragments to confirm their assessment.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed between 1,200 and 1,400 miles per hour, which is faster than a typical meteor.
The Air Force and Civil Aeronautics Administration could not find any records of aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a vivid blue sphere with flaming sparks or streamers
